title: wrong HSL to RGB conversion when using the color picker
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3831
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.17763

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an hsl color attribute in a css file as such:     `color: hsl(231, 6%, 24%);`
2. Use Color picker to convert it into rgb (by clicking the top panel of the color picker)
3. The result is `rgb(57, 58, 64);` which is incorrect, it should be `rgb(58, 59, 65);`

![vscode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1499269/66129048-6d95f780-e5ef-11e9-8a18-a622cb05e000.gif)


Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Each component (r, g and b) seems to be truncated rather than rounded after the HSL to RGBA calculation.

However, if I run the function  `HSLA.toRGBA` located in `src/vs/base/common/color.ts` then the result is correct, because each component are correctly rounded. Proof: https://repl.it/repls/FirsthandVirtualLanguage

title: [json] JSON formatter does not allow vertical alignment

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
```
Version: 1.38.1
Commit: b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0
Date: 2019-09-11T13:30:08.229Z
Electron: 4.2.10
Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
Node.js: 10.11.0
V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
OS: Linux x64 5.2.14-200.fc30.x86_64
```
All whitespace formatting is lost:

* vertical value alignment
* value grouping (using an empty line)
* single item lists are expanded to multiple lines

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a JSON file and whitespace align values:
```
{
    "foo": {
        "foo1":         "var1",
        "somelongname": "another value",
        
        "anothergroupofvariables":  "separated by an empty line",
        "key":                      "value",
        
        "singlelistitem": [ "oneitem" ]
    }
}
```
2. Format the document using `Ctrl + Shift + I`
```
{
    "foo": {
        "foo1": "var1",
        "somelongname": "another value",
        "anothergroupofvariables": "separated by an empty line",
        "key": "value",
        "singlelistitem": [
            "oneitem"
        ]
    }
}
```
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

According to the RFC7159 JSON standard whitespace alignment is allowed: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/pdfrfc/rfc7159.txt.pdf.

I'm reporting this here, since this is affecting the default JSON formatter. Please advise if I should report this elsewhere.

I agree whitespace alignment makes no sense for JSON strings generated and read mainly by machines, but for JSON strings written and maintained by humans, whitespace alignment is essential for good readability and quick object identification.

title: [Feature Request]Add option so [Auto Find In Selection] enable [Find In Selection] ONLY if selected text contains multiple lines
Image preview should not zoom on first click if unfocused
body:
**Repo**
1. Open an image to the side of a text editor
1. Start with the text editor focused
1. Now click into the image editor to focus it

**Bug**
The first click ends up zooming the image. Clicking should only zoom when the editor is already focused

title: Disabling/Re-enabling image preview extension steals focus
body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81674

Steps to reproduce:
* Open an image
* Open image preview extension page, disable and reload
* The image view tab has a loading indicator
* Switch to the extension page to enable it, but nothing is clickable
* Go back to the image tab and revisit the extension page fixes the issue

title: Two launch configurations with the same preLaunchTask trigger "already running" warning
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.14.6

Steps to Reproduce:

With the following .vscode/launch.json:
```json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "compounds": [
    {
      "name": "all",
      "configurations": ["web-server", "web-ui"]
    }
  ],
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "web-server",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "port": 20006,
      "restart": true,
      "preLaunchTask": "npm: dev-web"
    },
    {
      "name": "web-ui",
      "type": "chrome",
      "request": "launch",
      "url": "http://localhost:20005/",
      "timeout": 20000,
      "webRoot": "${workspaceFolder}/web",
      "preLaunchTask": "npm: dev-web"
    }
  ]
}
```

Launching the "all" configuration works properly, but presents the following:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41373/66068681-e66b5580-e502-11e9-8b90-531f18cb47c7.png)

title: Fix-81729 Preserve case in Search and Replace isn't working when I use group substitution
body:
@roblourens , This was not touched upon when preserve case was implemented , I have changed it to make it work for group substitution also . The gist of the change is that instead of returning `text.replace(this._regExp, this.pattern);` we return `text.replace(this._regExp, this.buildReplaceString(match, preserveCase));`

**NOTE : I have changed test methods to the standard used in other functions to make it look cleaner as this was getting pretty messy , and existing test methods would cover this fix test cases**

title: SCM: Display current line length in source control commit message input (Closes 81029)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Closes #81029 

Implements a line character counter as requested in #81029.

https://streamable.com/0tjyc

A few considerations about this implementation:
- I implemented a function to check if a given character is an EOL character, which compares a given character to `\r` and  `\n`. While it works on macOS, I've not yet been able to test this in other operating systems and I'd much rather use an already tested and trusted implementation, but I couldn't find it in the existing codebase.

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/d58af3cb013fd7678587e62e41c0b8b05225b11e/src/vs/base/browser/ui/inputbox/inputBox.ts#L570-L572

- As you can see in the linked video, I had to make a few visual design choices (positioning, padding, fixed width, etc.). If you disagree with any of my decisions or if there is anything else that I can do to improve this implementation please let me know, as this is my first time implementing something more than a simple bug fix in vscode. Thanks 😄

title: Debug: improve path conversion in dap arguments
body:
Our current approach is very error prone since we hard code all the requests that have uris and try to fixSourcePath them. 
I think we should just go through all the requets and look for `Source` objects and convert them all similar to how vscode is converting URIs.

Code pointer to the current approach 
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/2943151b3aecaef0bb5ebec2c7188495df0cbfaf/src/vs/workbench/contrib/debug/common/debugUtils.ts#L194

title: Use settings for trusted domains
body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/80595

We should not invent a new story for managing the trusted domains, but use the settings.

- That way the setting will be part of (future) settings sync.
- defaults come from the settings defaults
- make it a map `{ [ domain:string]: boolean; } | false` so you can fine-tune the defaults (and e.g. remove a default entry like localhost) (consistent with other settings like watcher/searc filters)

- make the setting available in user settings only
- disallow that extension make changes to the settings, if that is a concern.
(But note that extensions can cause worse things to your machine than hiding a 'Do you want to open an external website...' dialog)

title: What should happen when a new file is saved with a filename pattern that should open in a webview editor?
body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81698

Scenario:
Have a webview editor extension installed that contributes for *.txt.
Create a new file. Enter something in it so it isn't empty.
Save it as something.txt
What should happen next?

Currently, nothing happens. It stays in the default VS Code editor. It might make sense to have the choose editor quick pick open.

title: [json] indicate that draft-03 schemas are not supported

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
No duplicate issue exists
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.13.6

Steps to Reproduce:

Open a new document.
Set language mode to JSON.
Provide the following content...

```
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema",
  "type":"array",
  "items": {}
}
```

`items` is incorrectly highlighted as invalid because it's an object.
This is incorrect, but is likely because the meta-schema is being parsed not as a draft-3 schema.

In draft-3, `type` would accept schemas as well as primitive types as strings.
This was removed in draft-4.

Given that it's not expected many people use draft-3, it may be preferable to not support draft-3 at all, and in stead indicate that draft-3 is not supported.

This case can be identified when loading a schema for a JSON document, and detecting that both `$schema` and `id` (not `$id` for draft-3) are `"http://json-schema.org/draft-03/schema#"`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes


FYI: I'm one of the core team on the JSON Schema spec itself.

title: When two editors are contributed for the same file, neither gets chosen
body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81698

This happens even if I make one of them `"discretion": "default"`

This first time I opened a .png with two editors to handle png installed, I was shown an editor that had a message about the file being binary. 
I opened the file as binary.
Then I ran the reopen command to open with one of my image editors. That worked and activated the editor extension.
After that, when opening pngs they opened as binary then asked me to pick which editor to use.

This seems like an awkward flow. 
- I shouldn't have gotten the binary message, just immediately show me the quick pick with editor options.
- Later, I don't think the file should open as binary first then offer the quick pick. Only show the quick pick, and offer to make one of the editors default.

title: Regex group replacement fails
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use `^\[((?:(?!Exposed).)*)\ninterface (?!mixin)` and `[Exposed=Window, $1\ninterface ` on the search pane for batch text conversion
2. See the preview, the $1 is not being replaced with the relevant group match.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3396686/66029969-4c73cf00-e53b-11e9-8fae-c1f1ed008296.png)

The same just works with in-file text replacement (Control+H).

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Webview editor doesn't appear in Open Previous Editor From History command
body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81698

Open an image using the webview editor.
Open another editor.
Close the image.
Run the Open Previous Editor from History command.
Expected: I can re-open the image.
Actual: It's not listed as an option.

title: Productize or drop workbench.dialogs.customEnabled
body:
Currently it shows as unknown setting.

If this is officially supported, please also provide a good implementation for the about dialog when running desktop. When I added `IDialogService#about()` I was not aware the browser based dialog service was ever used from desktop (from https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81763)

title: Update the yeoman generator to use '${defaultBuildTask}' in the launch.json
body:
Testing #81637

Now that there is support for `${defaultBuildTask}` we should use it in the yeoman generator in the generated `launch.json` file for the `preLaunchTask`:

```json
	"configurations": [{
			"name": "Run Extension",
			"type": "extensionHost",
			"request": "launch",
			"runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
			"args": [
				"--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceFolder}"
			],
			"outFiles": [
				"${cwd}workspaceFolder}/out/**/*.js"
			],
			"preLaunchTask": "${defaultBuildTask}"
		}
```

title: Unable to Search in Marketplace
body:
Issue Type: Bug I am unable to search the Marketplace for extesnions. I can see, access and install extensions from the Marketplace ONLy when using the pre-defined Filters, e.g @sort:installs lists the extensions, from where I can select, view the details and install, but I cannot search for extensions e.g. by @category:keymaps or by Name e.g. "Notepad", anthing NOT in the predefined filter options ALWAYS shows 'We cannot connect to the Extensions Marketplace at this time, please try again later". Yes I am behind a Coporate Firewall. Yes I have added the required proxy, which works perfectly with Node NPM, Python, PIP & Apache NetBeans etc I also have no issues with Extension Download/Install in VS2017 or VS2019. VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

title: css.lint.hexColorLength seems to be now irrelevant
body:
Issue still occurs in Insiders v1.39.0

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.14.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set css.lint.hexColorLength to error or warning
2. Create a css file with a wrongly formatted color value
```
div {
    color: #ccc0003;
}
```

Expected behavior:
An error or warning as per the `css.lint.hexColorLength` setting.

Actual behavior:
A `css-propertyvaluexpected` error.

The `css.lint.hexColorLength` setting seems to no longer be relevant.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? Yes

title: The html.suggest.html5 disables non-HTML5 features

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
This bug happens in the Insiders v1.39.0

- VSCode Version: 1.39.0
- OS Version: 10.14.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set `html.suggest.html5` to `false`
2. Try getting autocompletion for any non-HTML5 attributes or values, like `class` or `style`.

Expected behavior:
As per the `html.suggest.html5` description (Controls whether the built-in HTML language support suggests HTML5 tags, properties and values) I expected that non-HTML5 tags, properties and values would not be affected, so attributes like `class` or `style` would still have autocompletion.

Actual behavior:
No attributes or values at all have autocompletion, it seems to be completely disabled.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? Yes

title: Add a way to initializate debug extension before every new debug session

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Version: 1.39.0-insider
Commit: b0d714d2de2886060e0904bf0cc774e0d70667cd
Date: 2019-09-26T09:05:41.420Z
Electron: 6.0.9
Chrome: 76.0.3809.146
Node.js: 12.4.0
V8: 7.6.303.31-electron.0
OS: Darwin x64 18.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a powershell file with the PowerShell e x tension
2. drop a breakpoint and F5
3. Hit the restart button when the breakpoint is hit

You'll notice nothing happens... this is because `resolveDebugConfiguration` is not run for when the debug adapter is starting up again so it can't set up needed state on the client side.

The 'restart' command isn't supported so this is behavior should be shutting down and starting up the debug adapter again.

Is this by design that it's not running `resolveDebugConfiguration` on restart? If so, any recs on how we can set up state in the extension host side before the debug adapter is launched?

title: Image Preview extension has no contributions even though it contributes a custom editor
body:
Testing #81674

Are custom editors not surfaced in the "Contributions" tab? Should they be?
